change.item: This finding aid was manually revised and updated to EAD 2.0 specifications by Sara Filion
This finding aid was updated in alignment with LC EAD 2.0 specifications using a python script created by Erik Radio.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Typescript chapters of a story, written in relay by Erskine Caldwell, Rosemary Taylor, Leslie Ernenwein, Joseph Wood Krutch, Roy Chapman Andrews, Ruth Suckow, Nelson C. Nye, Ann Ritner, and Elliot Arnold. Published serially in the Arizona Daily Star, March 28 to April 5, 1951, as a promotion for the first annual Tucson Festival of the Arts.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the user to obtain permission to publish from the owner of the copyright (the institution, the creator of the record, the author or his/her transferees, heirs, legates, or literary executors). The user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Arizona Board of Regents for the University of Arizona, its officers, employees, and agents from and against all claims made by any person asserting that he or she is an owner of copyright.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Nine Shots in the Dark (AZ 193). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Proposed by bookseller Eugene Steinheimer, each author wrote a chapter of the story on a relay basis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Typescript chapters of a story, written in relay by Erskine Caldwell, Rosemary Taylor, Leslie Ernenwein, Joseph Wood Krutch, Roy Chapman Andrews, Ruth Suckow, Nelson C. Nye, Ann Ritner, and Elliot Arnold.

relatedmaterial.p: Published serially in the Arizona Daily Star, March 28 to April 5, 1951, as a promotion for the first annual Tucson Festival of the Arts.
